titles: To the Right Honorable, the Councel of State And to the Honorable Committee, by them appointed in the case of the post-masters. The humble petition of the post-masters of the several roads of England.
author: England and Wales. Council of State.
notes: With an order of the Council of State dated 30 March 1653, conferring on Edmund Prideaux, Attorney-General, the charge of the Inland Post, with the assistance of the Postmasters -- Cf. Steele.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "pasted upon ye posts 2d of Aprill".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Postal service --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
